intro: Meibomia dasyacra, commonly known as the rough meibomia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough or hairy texture, contributing to its common name. Meibomia dasyacra is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
